title: Déjà Vu: Assemble Web Apps from Modules
description: Research project directed by Prof. Daniel Jackson and Dr. Santiago Perez De Rosso. Originally published in SPLASH'19, Déjà Vu has become an open-source platform for building web apps. It features a catalog of full-stack functionality and an HTML-like language for assembling web apps using the catalog.

title: CLEVR: Collaborative Learning Environments in Virtual Reality
description: Research project directed by MIT Education Arcade and MIT Game Lab. CLEVR creates a feasible immersive learning experience through virtual reality. In this project, our team of six developed a VR Game called CellVerse to help teams of high school students learn cell biology.

title: Soft Textiles from 3D Printed Rigid Materials
description: I designed and 3D printed the interlocking structure that turns rigid materials into soft textiles. I demonstrated its strechability by stitching it onto a piece of clothing.

title: Leiserchess: Chessbot Performence Competition (Ranked 1st in class)
description: Final project of 6.172: Performance Engineering of Software Systems. In this project, our team of four implemented the fastest chessbot AI in class, which uses open book, bitmaps, alpha-beta pruning and various other performance engineering techniques. Implemented in C.

title: ShaperSketch: Using Shape Grammar to Sketch
description: A tool for entry level users to create sketch using 2D shape grammar.

title: Weather App that Uses Texts as Form
description: A weather app that uses the form (shape and interaction) of texts to convey the feeling of the weather. Implemented using p5.js (processing).

title: Catology: a Directory for Cat Species
description: A webpage for cat lovers users to search, filter and learn more about different cat species. Implemented using p5.js (processing).

title: LoneStar: an Environmental Balance Game
description: Final project of 6.073: Game Development. The player needs to survive on a planet while balancing among power, food and the emission of carbon dioxide.

title: The Temperature Sensing Vest
description: This vest lights up when it is being worn and changes the color of its light depending on its surrounding temperature.

title: The Mosaic Stool
description: The mosaic stool features its soft and wooden seat surface. In this project, I used a straw rope to connect small wooden blocks to create a soft surface out of rigid materials.

title: Bus Stop near Stata Center
description: In this project, I designed, modeled and rendered a bus stop shelter. It features its glass walls and the convex lenses in the shelter ceiling, which gather sun light for the people waiting for the bus on a cold Boston day.

title: Shape Grammar Origami
description: I designed and folded a 3D unit structure that derives into different interesting geometries when repeating with different shape grammar rules.
